intro: Klasea centauroides subsp. komarovii, commonly known as the Komarovii klasea, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its diverse and often strikingly beautiful flora. The plant features fleshy, cylindrical stems that are typically green or reddish in color, adapted to store water in arid environments. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually pale yellow or white, appearing in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
